channel.title: Help with JAVA!
channel.description: Hi Wen i run a .bat it says `Java` Is not a vaid Command or batch file or sumin wat shurd i do>

item.title: Help with JAVA!
item.dc:creator: @underdogz underdogz
item.description:
@underdogz wrote:

look see how it says
C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_##\bin; you change the ## to your Java my is 1.6.0_07 so the ## I change to ##

Same with this one CLASSPATH=C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_##\bin;%CLASSPATH%; ## them to you java number for me it would be agine 1.6.0_07 hope this helped =)

item.title: Help with JAVA!
item.dc:creator: @underdogz underdogz
item.description:
@underdogz wrote:

[quote author=Threatening link=topic=293052.msg2359766#msg2359766 date=1217529371]
Your environment variables are wrong…

[quote author=stormcutter link=topic=285415.msg2312153#msg2312153 date=1215105074]
Step 4
Now you need to set environment variables. It may be challenging for new people, but you will eventually get it.

First of all, open my computer and press view system information. Something will popup with lots of tabs. Select the one that says “advanced” then at the bottom click on environment variables.

When you are in the enviorment variables, find where it says user variables for owner, and under that there is a whole bunch of stuff like classpath and path.

If you already have a thing that says “classpath” inside, then just edit it and put this in

CLASSPATH=C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_##\bin;%CLASSPATH%;

if you dont create a new variable call it classpath and put that in.

Then find the “Path” variable and edit it and put this in-

C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_##\bin;

Now you are done with the environment variables!
Note: If you have another version of jdk, for the part that says _0.6 in both classpath and path, change it to your jdk.

Use that guide to fix.
I edited the environment variables, put whichever java you have…
Like JDK 6 update 6 = C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_06\bin;

So yeah… hope this helped

Read full topic
